meanings.definition: The act of bending the knee in worship or reverence.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the people made genuflections as a sign of respect.
meanings.sent2: The genuflections of the worshippers showed their deep reverence for the sacred place.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to make genuflections to her teddy bear, mimicking a royal ceremony.
meanings.sent4: His genuflections to tradition were evident in every aspect of his life.
meanings.sent5: The genuflections of the monks echoed softly in the ancient chapel.

meanings.definition: A gesture of respect or submission, typically involving bending at the knee.
meanings.sent1: The knight's genuflections before the king displayed his loyalty and humility.
meanings.sent2: She made quick genuflections before entering the presence of the queen.
meanings.sent3: The dog's playful genuflections amused the children in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her genuflections to authority were unwavering, even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The genuflections of the soldiers symbolized their unwavering commitment to their country.
